RXN_state_t Struct Reference

A structure containing the information for the current processing state. Create a buffer of MAX_BUF_SIZE in the heap or stack and assign this memory to RXN_state.buffer_ptr to be used in a Non-Blocking API function. More...

#include <RXN_structs.h>

Detailed Description

A structure containing the information for the current processing state. Create a buffer of MAX_BUF_SIZE in the heap or stack and assign this memory to RXN_state.buffer_ptr to be used in a Non-Blocking API function.

Note:
The state object needs to be initialized properly before first use. Please see the given example.

Example Usage: 

 // Instantiate the state object
 RXN_state_t state;

 // Initialize the initiate state
 memset(&state, 0, sizeof(state));
 state.buffer_ptr = &state.buffer[0];
Since:
6.0.0

Field Documentation

Internal use only. Buffer to store internal state.

Internal use only.

Internal use only. Pointer to list of dynamic memory allocated.

Status of the API call.

Internal use only.

Internal use only.
